text: INT. BEDROOM -вЂ”
Tiny golden wheels and gears turning lazily upon metal rods. Mechanic Small and intricate. Glittering in the sunlight.

The gears are turning within an ANTIQUE DESK CLOCK sitting on a book sh pendulum swinging back and forth behind the glass housing. The room is barren except for a pair of open suitcases and a bed that stripped. Sitting on the mattress is ...
Smart and clever. Dressed in a graduation gown and staring out the seems to be lost in thought, immobile, until the bedroom door swings
aged seventeen and wearing a suit and tie, steps inside.
Dad says we gotta get moving. We're late.
I'm getting ready.
You're sitting on the bed.

(dryly) Thanks for clearing that up. I'll be right down. He steps out. Julia takes a framed picture out of her suitcase -- a candid shot of he standing with her MOTHER, forties, a healthy and vibrant woman. JULIA (cont'd) Sure do miss you. Above her, a CEILING FAN rotates. Creating a soft HUMMING.
Julia walks out of the building where her father, GUY LEVIN, an older man face, waits. Connor is checking his reflection in the car windo his tie, fussing with his hair.
You ready?
All set. I packed up everything. (remembering) Oh, except Mom's clock -- I think there's something wrong with it. I telling the right time.

I'll get it fixed. Probably just needs a few new parts. Guy smiles at Julia for a moment. Very warmly. GUY (cont'd) You look just like your mother. Julia is momentarily uncomfortable. But she recovers, father on the cheek.
We'll be late.
smiles and kisses her  Students dressed in graduation caps and gowns are gathered on the grounds. Julia stands by herself, taking pictures with a professional Nikon camera the camera upon ...

beautiful and sexy. Very particular and demanding. She sm perfectly as Julia snaps the picture. But her boyfriend, SAM BURNSIDE, cute mischievous, sporting pink hair and loud clothes, makes a face. Winding her film, Julia searches a moment, then smiles. Raising her c she snaps a picture of ...
Early twenties. Dark hair. Strapping and perfectly handsome. He wears a b striped tie with his starched white shirt and graduation gown.  He kisses her. Passionate and gentle.
You packed up?
Ready to move in. I'll be storing some of the stuff you've already got. CD player. Microwave.
(suggestively) Bed. Julia smiles at him.
Bed.
Med School doesn't start until August. At least not for the freshmen got plenty of time to see Europe, take the car trip up north ...
I hope it won't be a drag. There's a lot of stuff to move out of my mothe
Our friends will be there. It'll be fun.
I hope so.  Beat.
You okay?
Tense.
Would it help if I massaged your breasts?
No.
Because it would help me.
(stifling laughter) Maybe later. The students start forming into lines. JULIA (cont'd) Hey, I saw your Mom and kid sister. Where's your Dad? Beat.
He's not coming.
But it's your  graduation. Paul shrugs again. A brief sting of hurt on his face.
Wasn't a good enough reason in High School either. Paul looks away. Julia knows how painful this is and to diminish it. Julia smiles and runs her finger across his tie knot.
I like your tie. UCLA colors.

won't insult him by trying  School spirit. I am a Bruin. The lines start moving towards the stadium. Hundreds of CHEERS rise up fr graduating students. As she walks, a sound draws Julia's attention. Standing on the lawn is a more than four years-old, SOBBING and clinging to his mother's legs Julia stops walking as she gazes at the child. The line comes to a ha her.
(cont'd) Julia. We can't graduate unless you move.
Sorry.  She stalks walking again. Paul puts his arms around her.
A big, traditional house nestled in the hills. PARENTS and gradu STUDENTS exchange polite conversation in the yard.
Sitting between a pair of open french doors is "the gang" consisting of J and Terry and Sam. They throw around conversation, ignoring the par
It's secluded? Nobody said anything to me about the cabin being secluded
I said it was a cabin in the woods. I thought seclusion was a given.
I'm no good out in the woods. You know what lives in the woods? Animals t Animals that bite.
So avoid the animals.
I really appreciate you guys helping me. I couldn't move everythin
Hey, it's our last chance to be together. Terry and I are excited.  (turns) Aren't we, Ter? She's not excited.
Can I bring my cotton bedsheets to the cabin? If I try to sleep in anyth cotton, I get hives.
Whatever makes you happy. Sam grabs a large drawing pad from the steps. He opens it.
Speaking of which, I've got your graduation gift. As specified.
Let's see. Sam holds up a sketch of Clark Kent changing to Superman.
Like it?
It's great. Thanks Sam. Paul checks out the drawing. His nose crinkles.
Superman? Why'd you want a drawing of Superman?
He's very attractive.
(staring) You're kidding.
He's not even real.
I think most women tend to wonder if Superman is super in every way.
I don't.
You see. There goes your argument.
(thoughtfully) But Spiderman has a nice ass. Off everyone's
TERRY (cont'd)  What?
Julia finishes washing her hands. Dries them. Grabbing her camera and th Julia opens the bathroom door ...
++. and freezes. Standing within an open bedroom is ...

Another college graduate. Tan and attractive. Dressed exactly like Paul - white shirt, gold and blue striped tie. He pulls off his tie an his shirt.  Julia doesn't move. The student peels off his shirt. Her eyes are drawn to a Superman tattooed on his shoulder. The student
insignia catches sight of Julia in the hallway. Her face turns bri immediately. She starts to laugh. He smiles at her. A bit flattered. Flirting.
Changing into something more formal. He holds up a pair of ripped jeans. Julia backs down the hallway. Still laughing. Embarrassed.
I'm sorry. I was just using the ... (laughs) Really. I'm sorry.
I'll forgive you this once. She quickly leaves. The blond student watches her go. A grin on his face.
Julia walks out the back door. Stifling her laughter. Paul is talking with Guy on the lawn. Julia SNAPS a picture of them toget her film, and notices ...

Sweet and innocent. Sitting on a bench. Motionless. Julia walks towards her. The little girl is staring across the lawn a shed. Transfixed. A group of children are playing on the grass it. The girl becomes aware of Julia's presence and turns around.
(quiet) Silence.

You sitting here all by yourself? The girl slowly nods "Yes." JULIA (cont'd) Don't you want to play with the other kids? The girls shakes her head "No."  JULIA (cont'd) Want me to leave you alone? The girl shakes her head "No." More silence. JULIA (cont'd) Want to mix this up and ask me something? The little girl notices the camera.
Are you taking pictures for Sam's family?
No, I'm just (then) I'm a friend of Sam's. But I'm also a photographer. Beat.
Will you take a picture of me?
Why?
So you won't forget me. I take pictures.
(surprised) Why would I forget you?
Because they're coming for me. A long beat. Julia sits next to her.
Who is?
The monsters.
What monsters?
There. Behind the door. The girl points towards the pool shed. The rusted door of the shed is sli Just a crack.
Those other kids don't look too scared.
They should be. Beat.
(playing along) So how come only you can see them?

head_text.subj: FORWARD AND SPEAKS IN A HUSHED WHISPER.

text: Because I know they're real. I used to have a little brother, but they c him.

Now my parents say I never had a brother before. (pause) Soon ... my parents won't remember me either. Something about the girl's tone of voice is unnerving. As if she's resig this. A slight wind HISSES through the trees. The girl rises. GIRL (cont'd) I gotta go. They know I'm talking about them.
Wait a second. Julia SNAPS a picture of the girl. JULIA (cont'd) Feel better? The girl stares  at her.
Are you scared of monsters?
Beat.

I am. The girl turns and runs across the lawn. Julia is left sitting on the bench. She glances over at the pool shed a her camera and focuses on the door which is still cracked open.  She snaps the picture.
Julia and Paul are romantically entangled as they enter the apartment. A drunk. Kissing and frolicking. She strips off his jacket and tie. Paul a stops.

Wait a minute (grabbing both sides of his shirt) This is a job for ... Paul rips his shirt wide open. Buttons popping everywhere. They both s Joining together, he guides her towards the bathroom. The wind gently HISSES on the balcony. Windchimes spinning.

A cloud of hot steam. The soothing rush of warm water running over tanne skin. Julia stands underneath the shower, her body relaxing into Paul's ches muscular arms encircling her body, his lips buried in her neck and shou eyes are shut. Her expression is calm.
Standing in the guest bedroom at Sam's house. Young and muscular. Bathed The tattoo  on his shoulder.
Her eyes still pressed closed. Smiling a little. Water continues rushing from the shower head, creating a HISS that eventu
The setting sun blushes crimson across the rolling waves of the Pacific. along the highway is a RANGE ROVER, packed with luggage, headlights

Paul sits behind the wheel. He's bopping and RAPPING with Sam to HI BLARES from the speakers. Very energized. Julia sits on the passenger side, leaning against the window, trying to music. Terry looks just as miserable. Finally, Julia turns off t A silent beat. The guys catch their girlfriends' expressions.
Sorry.
(overlapping) Sorry. Terry leans forward between the seats.
So the cabin has electricity, right? And plumbing? Everything we need?
Uh-huh.
So it has everything.
It has everything.
Wait a minute. I hear a shoe about to drop.
Except a phone.
BAM! There it is.
(scandalized) I need a phone. It's like family to me. Mom, Dad, my brother .... phone.
So you're roughing it.
The last time I tried to rough it, I was in therapy for a year. Why didn have a phone?
I guess she wanted to be left alone. At least until she got sick. Paul looks to her.
This won't be too hard on you, will it? Staying at her place?
It's okay. I'm enjoying this. Julia smiles at him. Paul smiles back.
Good. He switches the radio back on and continues RAPPING with Sam. Julia and T stare straight ahead, ears pounding. This is turning into a LON
Paul's Range Rover makes its way down a long, winding road. The Rover' illuminate the woods lining the road on both sides.

The inside of the Range Rover is dark. Only the faint glow from the das provides any ambient illumination. Sam and Terry are snuggled toge back seat. Everything is quiet. Julia is thinking. Finally, she breaks the silence.
Do you believe in monsters? A beat. Everyone else in the car trades looks.
We've been in the car too long.
I'm just  asking.
Like what? The Boogeyman?
The Boogeyman. The thing under the bed. The monster hiding in the closet
What made you think of that?
A little girl at Sam's house. She was convinced there was a monster try her.
You're saying you believe her? Julia is suddenly on the spot. She backtracks.
Of course I don't. There are no monsters. Not really.
Sure there are. Ted Bundy. Son of Sam. Ed Gein.
Who was Ed Gein?
He was a mass murderer. This old hermit who'd kill people and take the wanted. Heads. Livers. Intestines. Sex organs.
Why did he use the parts for?
Everything. The police found a skull that was used for a soup bowl. Faces and mounted like hunting trophies on the wall. Bones were use furniture.
He also wore their skin. Like clothes. Terry recoils into her seat. Grossed out.
Sorry I asked.
You wanted proof. There it is.
But it's not like he's a monster under the bed.
So?
So why are kids afraid of that?

Because they live in a completely different world than we do. (then) Think about it. Why do kids pick up on things that we can't? ... Bumps in footsteps in the hallway? ... A thumping inside their clo
Overactive imagination.

Wrong. Perfect awareness. (beat) Kids have a perfect awareness of everything around them. Every sound.  shadow. Everything gets quiet. SAM (cont'd) The Boogeyman could be real. So could monsters. Just because you've nev doesn't mean they aren't there. Silence. The car engine purrs softly. This is starting to make sense. spooky.
All right. I'm creeped out. But my bullshit alarm is going off.
You just can't handle it.
Right. Because it's bullshit.
Serial killers aside, my take on this subject is very simple. If I don't picture of it -- it's not real.
Okay, is this conversation like a radio station? Can we just change the Because personally, I'd like to get to sleep tonight. Terry has just finished saying these words, when --

Paul SLAMS on the brakes. Too late.
throwing the shape into a ditch at the side of the road. The Range Rover swerves and comes to a SQUEALING HALT.
Everyone catches their breath. A moment of dead silence.
(cont'd) Everyone  okay?
(nods) We're fine.

We'd better check the car.  She steps out of the Rover. The others follow.
The hazard lights are switched on. Paul walks around to the front of The bumper is dented.
Look at that. There's a couple thousand dollars out of my wallet.

Sure. For a couple hundred dollars. Sam looks down the road. He can barely make out a large form resting lif ditch. He starts walking towards it.
I'm sorry about your car, Paul ...

(begrudging) Yeah, well. Shit happens. The conversation becomes distant as Sam walks slowly up the r past the yellow flashing HAZARD LIGHTS which CLICK rhythmically . click, click Sam approaches the ditch. Darkness is all around. wee. Sam picks up a stick and pokes at the body. Nothing happens. He pokes at the corpse again. The hind legs of the corpse suddenly twitch. A reflex action. Sam leaps life nearly scared out of him.  A flap of hairless skin slides away from one of the animal's hind l leans forward to get a better look, becoming simultaneously repulsed an

Did you see the leg?

What about it? Sam takes the stick and gently pushes away the flap of torn skin for a The group leans forward. A deep bleeding wound has been exposed. Through the torn flesh and blood charcoal skin, the group can see bones flashing into the moonlight intermingled with the animal's skeleton are ...
Glittering and clean. A series of connected stainless steel threads and that have grown together.
Ever seen anything like that?
No.
It looks like steel. Like someone put steel into its body.
I don't think it was put in there. It looks like it grew that way.
That's impossible. What kind of animal has steel in its skeleton Terry steps forward tentatively.

Come on, honey. It's a dog. Not a zombie.
Julia? Where's your camera?
It's in the car.

I've got it. Paul races back to the Range Rover and opens the passenger door. camera. Julia takes a step back into the middle of the trees, creating a soft HISSING noise as shadows. Paul returns and hands the camera to Sam.

road. He withdraws Julia's The wind is sifting through the the branches dance and twist in the  I'm not touching it. Sam kneels down. He points the camera and shoots. The camera flash cuts through the darkness and falls upon the corpse fora millisecond of clarity. Twisted metal. Skin. Appendages. Madness. Both of the young men stand frozen, thunderstruck, staring down at th shape in front of them. A long period of amazed silence follows.
That's wrong. That's all wrong. Paul shakes his head.
That's not a dog.
(stunned) What were those things coming out of its back? Paul starts recoiling. His stomach is getting weak.
That's not a dog. The cool summer wind WHISTLES through the trees around them.
(sickened) That doesn't even make sense.
Paul ... Paul looks over at her. JULIA (cont'd) Let's get in the car.
We need some flashlights.
(hushed) Screw the flashlights.
What the hell is it?
Dude. We're outta here. Julia and Paul walk briskly to the Range Rover. Sam and Terry follow the back over their shoulders.
What the hell is it?!  Paul tosses the camera into the Rover's back seat. He SLAMS the door shut the front passenger door. A soft THUMPING from the woods. Almost like footsteps.
Get in the car. Julia hops into the front seat and SLAMS her door.
The atmosphere is quickly turning into panic. and Terry close their doors.
Paul jumps behind the wheel as both Sam  I want to know what that thing was. Paul presses the automatic door lock. THUNK.
Paul, start the car.
Keys ... He searches his pockets. They're empty. He checks his jacket.
I want to know what it was.
Will you shut up? Paul fishes out the car keys from his jacket pocket. He starts the igniti engine ROARS to life.
A heavy THUMP. Right outside the back window. Sam and Terry instinctivel towards the rear hatch.
There's something behind the car.
Go!  Paul hits the gas.
The Range Rover disappears into the night. The calm and unnerving quiet of the woods are left behind. The wind WH softly.
A fast food joint at the side of the road.
Everyone is sitting quietly at a table. Fast food leavings are litter their plastic trays. Nobody is saying anything or looking at one anothe  Finally ...
I want to get the body. Everyone's face drops into shock. Paul almost laughs.
You do that. We'll wait for your ass right here. Sam leans forward in his seat. Intense.
Nothing about that thing looked right. Absolutely nothing. skeleton. There was metal in its
Maybe it wasn't metal. It might've just looked like metal.
There were fucking gears, for Chrissake.
Fine. Go back out there. Do whatever the hell you want. But count me ou
We've already got a picture, Sam.
Let's get a few more then. I want to get a good look at that thing up clo
(adamant) I'm not going back there.
Let Julia decide. It's her camera. The group stares at Julia. She remains silent.

Your call. Julia stares back at all of them. A moment. A small CHILD begins CRYING and SCREAMING in the restaurant. Julia flin unexpected sound, glancing over at the child's parents as they quie She rises from the table.
I have to use the bathroom. She walks straight into the bathroom. After she's gone ...
I'm not going back there.

Large and poorly lit. Several closed bathroom stalls face a row of huge mirror. A toilet FLUSHES. Julia leaves one of the stalls and pulls the doo behind her. She moves to the mirror, washes her hands, and retrieves her purse. Water DRIPS from one of the leaky pipes in the bathroom while the flu over the mirror CRACKLES softly. Julia is about to brush her hair, something unnerves her. She cocks her head slightly. A feeling. She turns around and checks out the bathroom. The doors to the stal closed shut. Empty and quiet. She starts brushing her hair. A few moments pass. Then, she stops an the water DRIPPING from the pipe. Julia turns back around and looks bathroom.  One of the stall doors all the way at the end is now slightly open. Just enough to reveal a patch of darkness and gloom within. The sound of water dripping abruptly stops. Silence follows. Julia looks like she's about to crawl out of her skin. She quickly sh brush back into her purse and leaves.
Julia walks towards her friends as they collect themselves. Everyone getting their stuff together.
I want to leave.
Hold up. We're coming. The CHILD starts CRYING again. Pointing at the bathroom. This disturbs Julia further.
Paul?
Okay. Slow down. The group leaves the table.

The group emerges from the restaurant. The parking lot is almost de people are in sight. Julia moves leisurely towards the Range Rover, just ahead of Terry an she'd walk a lot faster if Paul's arm weren't draped around her shou looks tight and nervous. Her eyes scanning the parking lot. The cars are empty. Sidewalk litter dances in the wind.

Paul starts the engine and pulls out of the parking relieved.

Done. She switches on the light. The group crowds around her.

What do you mean it's out of focus? I took the picture. The flash wen

Well, so much for that. Sam looks at the picture, then at his friends. With a look of somber f Sam quietly turns and charges up the stairs, taking two at a time. After he's gone
It's not a big deal. Whatever it was. (then) He'll get over  it.
Cloudy and overcast. A set of colorless waves CRASH into the rocks. and Terry walk just beyond the rippling surf, arguing with each oth

What about the blood? It wasn't red ... it was black -- it was like ... from a busted engine. and Julia coming

Let's find it. Cut it up. Study it.
(measured) Sam, I realize that you're an extroverted comic book artist and I'm a ne it's only now at this moment that I'm wondering why we're dating. Sam turns back to Julia --

So come with me. You take the pictures this time. If it's just a dead you're right and I'm wrong. But if it's not, we've got a picture

A monster. A set of foaming waves HISS as they slide along the sand.  Julia stands with her arms folded. There's something really creepy abo she doesn't want to admit.
Monsters don't exist.
What...? (pause) Sayin' yes ... or saying no? Julia stares at him, deadpan. Sam just stares right back.
The same lonely stretch of road from the night before. The Range Rover appears around a corner and pulls over to the side of the opens her door, camera in hand, and gets out. Sam follows her lead.
This is it?
I think so. You can see the way the road turns sharply to the left. The r drive was straight.

A new roll. You can have all the pictures you want. Julia and Sam start searching the ditch. Feet crunching in the dirt. Mo from the car. A soft THUMP echoes from somewhere in the woods. A place just beyond t pine branches and shrubbery that shivers in the breeze. Sam and Julia look around. They wait. Nothing. Nobody.
(slight grin) The Boogeyman lives here.
So will you if you keep talking like that. They keep walking. A beat passes.
Julia? Can I ask you something?
Go ahead.
Last night on the road, after I took the picture and we started walking car, did you have the same feeling?
What feeling?

That we were being chased. Julia doesn't say anything. She stops cold in her tracks. Just ahead of her, resting motionless in t A BODY ... Swathed in dark fur, twisted at a pathetic angle, huge gashes in its side of a DOBERMAN PINSCHER. Flies are BUZZING and swarming over the dog's open wounds. Julia and Sam move towards the dog's lifeless form.
There's your monster.
That's a dog.
Right. Sam kneels in front of the corpse. Waves off some flies.
That's not what I saw.
I don't see any other corpses on the side of the road, do you?  A long moment. Sam stares back down at the Doberman's body.
That's not what I saw.
Eyes slightly open. A misshapen form plagued with flies. The sound of INSECTS SWARMING drowns out the WIND HISSING through the

Paul is jogging through the woods. A light mist hangs in the cool air. Th the forest surround him.  Suddenly, the birds stop singing. Paul becomes aware of this. He stops looks around. The forest is deathly still. The sound of a TWIG being crushed underfoot. Then nothing. Another moment. Paul keeps going, a chill on his spine, looking back over shoulder.

A picture postcard community consisting of quaint storefront shops parks. Paul stands right in front of a freshly painted realty office buildin picketed fence, sipping a Coke, watching a HOMELESS WOMAN across t SCREAMING and SHOUTING at traffic. She's right next to the parked Range Rover.  Julia walks out of the realty office.
Finished?
Done. The cabin has a buyer.
What about the movers?
They're coming on Sunday afternoon so we'll have to start packing. The homeless woman starts walking off down the sidewalk. Moving away f Rover's parking  space.
Good. She's leaving. I thought we were gonna have to make a run for t
I feel sorry for those people.
Me too. But that doesn't mean I want to get screamed at.
People are ignoring her. Maybe that's the only way she can get atten
She's doing a  good job. Kept me away. They start crossing the street towards the car.
How does someone end up like that?
I think we're witnessing it first-hand with Sam. anyway?
A dog. Paul stares at her. Surprised.
What did you guys find on the road  Really?
Yeah. Personally, I'm glad we didn't find Frankenstein's monste
You just like being right.
(grins) Damn straight.

text: Sam is sitting on a fallen tree trunk, sketching on his drawing pad with intensity.
A rough drawing of the animal's leg, intertwined with steel rods and meta which culminate in a large pulley where the hip bone should be.

(not paying attention) Okay. He keeps watching.
Today.
I'm busy.
You're ina chat room with a bunch of strangers.

There's somebody in the shed. I couldn't see it when I took the p now it's there.

Give your "friends" my best. Julia takes the photograph and leaves. Paul types into his computer: "JUL BEST." The message pops up next to his user name. Within seconds, se user names in the chat room respond with "WHO'S JULIA???"

(on the phone) I'm not kidding, Dana. There's no phone. (beat) There's a jack and the phone line works, but there's no phone. Uh-huh. P able to get on the internet. I'm using his cell.
(quietly) I need you to look at something. Terry nods.
Hold on.
Here. Julia holds out the picture. Terry looks it over briefly.

(polite) Nice picture.  She gets back to her phone conversation. TERRY (cont'd) I'm back. (beat) I don't know if he has any free minutes, but he definitely won't after th conversation. Uh-huh. Thank God for AirTouch. Frustrated, Julia takes the picture and leaves the kitchen.

The air is completely still. A hush has fallen. The only sound is th CRICKETS CHIRPING in the grass. Julia wanders outside holding some of the developed photographs from t is sitting on the front steps, working on his drawing.
Sam? Could you look at... Sam looks up from his drawing pad.
What? Beat.

Never mind. Julia sits on the porch glider and looks through the photos. The little back over her shoulder. The blurred shape inside of the shed.  A moment passes. Julia shuts her eyes as a slight breeze comes up. into a dream-like state, calm and relaxed, before opening her ey

But it's not just that. Julia's voice becomes soft. As if she were telling a secret. JULIA (cont'd) I've also had this feeling. Ever since Sam disappeared. I can't shake i
What is it?
I feel like something's missing.
Something?
I don't know. It's on the tip of my tongue. that morning, something's not right. Like here
Right. Sam.
I just feel like ever since we woke up there's someone who should be  It's not Sam. (then) Did that palm reader say anything strange to you. Paul hesitates. He looks back at the night sky.
Beat.
Can I use your phone?
Anything at all?  A traditional home. The phone rings and Connor comes charging down the answers it.
Hello?
Julia is sitting on the couch.
Connor. It's Julia.
Oh. I thought you were someone else.
Nice to hear your voice too.
You having fun?
(understated) Not exactly.

No.
Well could you leave him a message?
Uh-huh.
Tell him that the movers didn't come, so I'll be here a few more days. I have some stuff of Mom's that he might want.
Okay.
Don't forget.
Jesus. Show a little faith. When have I ever forgotten something? INT. DARKROOM вЂ”

Paul's arm as he does push-ups, sweat beading on his bice rippling. The SOUND of MACHINES pulsates and segues into ... INT. DARKROOM вЂ”
Julia takes the  picture out of the developing basin.

text: Paul is sitting on the couch, wearing a UCLA cross country tank top and t shoes. Julia enters from the basement. She's carrying a stack of devel pictures.
Paul, you have to see this. The picture came out, but there's something strange in the middle of it. Just like the other one of the shed. He looks at the  picture.
Looks like someone on the carousel.
But there's no features. It's like a shadow.
So there wasn't enough light. Paul rubs his forehead. Julia is genuinely concerned.
What's the matter?
My head feels worse.
Maybe you should lie down.
I have to go running.
No you don't.
Of course I do. Your body's like a machine. It needs upkeep.
Not when you're physically ill.
I'll be okay.
Paul ...
I'll be okay. (about the picture) Is that it?
Not exactly. (beat) When I saw this picture, I decided to look at the other one. Just for com sake.
So? Julia takes out another photograph.
I pulled this one by mistake. The picture of that little girl from the She hands him the picture.  JULIA (cont'd) Look. Paul's face collapses into slack disbelief.

Okay. She squeezes his shoulder and walks into --

The Range Rover pulls down a crowded street.

pressed

VICTIM presses a white towel against his thigh. Blood gus A huge metal ROD sticks out of his leg.

Julia turns to Paul who sits silently in the passenger seat. He doesn't

Promise.

standing on the front porch. His wet hair plastered to his forehead, rain off his cheeks, his handsome face turned pallid and colorless. He manages a sheepish smile.

Dad.  Standing at the door is a man in his mid-fifties, MR. LOOMIS. A severe pr soured and weathered face. He stares at Paul without any sign of Paul notices the slight. He presses onward. A bit haltingly. Still hop trying to connect. PAUL (cont'd) I was hoping we could talk ... (beat) I know we haven't done much of that recently, but still ... (beat) I was hoping. Beat.  PAUL (cont'd) I'm in a lot of trouble. I'm getting sick ... and I was hoping ... (beat) I was hoping you could help. Paul is having difficulty speaking. He's almost reduced to tears as he s cold, stinging rain. PAUL (cont'd) I want to come home. Please Dad. (desperate) Please let me come home.  A moment of silence. PAUL (cont'd) Please? Julia? Julia turns around, searching, not immediately recognizing the figure approaches her -- It's Terry. But her once perfect appearance has become harsh and drawn. H hair has been colored dark brown. There are sagging circles under her e is colorless. She moves quickly. Nervously. Julia is  shocked.
Terry? Terry's hands tremble.
I'm glad you came. You don't have any idea how scared I've been.

Why?
Where are you parked?
On the street.
Good. If we keep moving, they might have trouble tracking us. Terry takes Julia's arm and leads her out of the market.
Terry is moving at a swift pace. She keeps looking back over her shoulder tries to keep up. Rain drenches them.
What the hell is going on? Where's Sam?
He's dead. This almost sends Julia reeling. Her mouth falls open.
What?
There's three things you should remember. Three things.
What happened to Sam?
First, whenever you see a baby or a kid crying, keep moving. That's your warning.
Warning against who?
Second, they Children can sense them. can control anything electrical or mechanical. Lamps. Ca
Terry, you're not making any sense.
Third -- they can change things. They can make you disappear.
Tell me what happened to Sam.
I am telling you. (terrified) They took him.  They made him disappear. Julia stops walking. Speechless.

POWERBOOK. A soft WHIRRING noise seeping from the computer as the student types. The WHIRRING becomes the HUMMING OF MACHINES. The Range Rover appears on the street and moves past.
(v.0.)  They take away your identity. People stop remembering you. Your place in vanishes.
Julia is behind the wheel. Terry is devouring a cigarette.
That's how they get you. By making people not even care about you anymore

The number I called at the bus station was his parents.  (cryptic) We didn't hit a dog on the road.
But I saw it.
They switched bodies.
Who are "they?" A cult? Killers? Terry starts laughing to herself. Tears welling in her eyes. Hopeless.
You have no idea. No idea what you're dealing with. (then) They don't even belong here. They're like ... like machines. That's what Like machines with all this skin and moving parts.
They're machines?
Monsters. They're monsters, Julia. Julia stops at a light.
crosses the street in front of them. He's just a yuppie phone. But Terry stiffens in her seat, watching him suspiciously. Then, almost as an aside, he winks at her. TERRY (cont'd) Drive.

Then make a right. Just keep driving. Julia is growing frightened by Terry's paranoia.
The Rover makes a right turn and cruises down another block.
Terry keeps her eyes riveted on the PEOPLE on the sidewalk. She's practic tears.
Remember when we hit that thing with the car? (hushed) It wasn't an accident. It was a set-up. They planned it all along.
How do you know  this?
Sam told me. He figured everything out.
Why are they coming after us? What do they want with us?
They have flesh and metal parts in their bodies. Sometimes they shed what need. But other parts keep getting worn out or lost. So they take p constantly to get new parts.
(soft) That's not  possible.
They wear the skin. That's why you don't notice them. Half of the time wearing people's skin. Or they're hiding in dark places. Alleys. Julia is horrified.
Terry ... please stop.
They take other parts too. Whatever they need. They're scavengers. No sen compassion. No remorse.
I don't believe this.

Joey?
That's what Sam saw. That's why he left. He woke up and got a look at the they were doing to Joey ...
Terry ...
Stripping him ... taking his skin off ... Julia pulls over to the curb and stops.

(amazed) You don't remember?
There were five of us. He came up in his own car. He was always wore the same thing for Christ sakes.
There were only four of us. You. Me. Paul. Sam. Terry is shaking now. Complete fright.
They got to you. They got to you.
Nobody got to me. Paul's best friend -- they  Terry starts collecting her things.
Look, could you drop me off at my brother's apartment? I need to pick up before I go to the airport.
Where are you going?
To see my parents.
You can't just leave.  Terry starts weeping. Grabbing her legs and squeezing them.
They put things in my legs so they can track me. It hurts.

Remember me. Please remember me. From the street outside the car, the sound of a TODDLER CRYING can be he head snaps around. She stares out the windshield at the screaming ch TERRY (cont'd) They found me again. Before Julia can react, Terry bolts from the car.

Julia. It's Paul.

At a pay phone.

He wouldn't let me in. He told me he didn't have a son. (then) Julia, everything in my wallet's gone. Credit cards. Money. Driv Everything.
between Julia and Paul.

Steam rises from the pipes. Bathing the stairwell in mist. The fluorescent lights above are glimmering in the darkness. Julia stands of the stairwell. She can't even see the bottom of the steps. Carefully, she  starts moving down. Her hand gripping the metal railing. The HUMMING OF MACHINES grows louder Her foot accidentally kicks a few pieces of metal on the steps. From somewhere within, she manages to steady herself. Keeps going throug awaiting steam curtain at the bottom.
